trans-unit.source: Model node links
trans-unit.target: Model node links

trans-unit.source: Beginner Artist
trans-unit.target: Beginner Artist

trans-unit.source: !Note In some versions of Stride, Model node links are called Bone links.
trans-unit.target: !Note In some versions of Stride, Model node links are called Bone links.

trans-unit.source: The model node link component attaches an entity to a node of a skeleton on another entity.
trans-unit.target: The model node link component attaches an entity to a node of a skeleton on another entity.

trans-unit.source: For example, imagine you have two models: a knight, and a sword. The character has a sword swinging animation. You can use a model link node to place the sword in the knight's hand and attach it to the correct node in the knight skeleton, so the sword swings with the knight animation.
trans-unit.target: For example, imagine you have two models: a knight, and a sword. The character has a sword swinging animation. You can use a model link node to place the sword in the knight's hand and attach it to the correct node in the knight skeleton, so the sword swings with the knight animation.

trans-unit.source: Set up a model node link component
trans-unit.target: Set up a model node link component

trans-unit.source: In the Scene Editor, select the entity you want to link to a node in another entity.
trans-unit.target: In the Scene Editor, select the entity you want to link to a node in another entity.

trans-unit.source: In the Property Grid, click Add component and select Model node link.
trans-unit.target: In the Property Grid, click Add component and select Model node link.

trans-unit.source: Add component
trans-unit.target: Add component

trans-unit.source: Game Studio adds a model node link component to the entity.
trans-unit.target: Game Studio adds a model node link component to the entity.

trans-unit.source: Model node link component
trans-unit.target: Model node link component

trans-unit.source: The component only has two properties: Node name and Target.
trans-unit.target: The component only has two properties: Node name and Target.

trans-unit.source: Next to Target, click Hand icon.
trans-unit.target: Next to Target, click Hand icon.

trans-unit.source: The Select an entity window opens.
trans-unit.target: The Select an entity window opens.

trans-unit.source: Select an entity
trans-unit.target: Select an entity

trans-unit.source: Select the model you want to link the entity to and click OK.
trans-unit.target: Select the model you want to link the entity to and click OK.

trans-unit.source: !Note The entity you link to must have a model with a skeleton, even if the model isn't visible at runtime.
trans-unit.target: !Note The entity you link to must have a model with a skeleton, even if the model isn't visible at runtime.

trans-unit.source: !Tip If you don't specify a model, Stride links the entity to the model on the parent entity.
trans-unit.target: !Tip If you don't specify a model, Stride links the entity to the model on the parent entity.

trans-unit.source: In Node name, select the node in the model you want to attach this entity to.
trans-unit.target: In Node name, select the node in the model you want to attach this entity to.

trans-unit.source: Select node
trans-unit.target: Select node

trans-unit.source: After you link the node, the Entity Tree shows the link in blue next to the entity name.
trans-unit.target: After you link the node, the Entity Tree shows the link in blue next to the entity name.

trans-unit.source: Model node link
trans-unit.target: Model node link

trans-unit.source: Offset
trans-unit.target: Offset

trans-unit.source: To add an offset to the linked entity, use the entity's TransformComponent.
trans-unit.target: To add an offset to the linked entity, use the entity's TransformComponent.

trans-unit.source: Transform
trans-unit.target: Transform

trans-unit.source: !Note If you don't want to add an offset, make sure the values are all set to 0,0,0.
trans-unit.target: !Note If you don't want to add an offset, make sure the values are all set to 0,0,0.

trans-unit.source: See also
trans-unit.target: See also

trans-unit.target: For examples of how model node links are used, see:

target.g: Cameras — Animate a camera with a model file
